result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad Joseph Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Commence no later than 12-15-14 @ 6 p.m.
Huber privileges.
Consecutive to: all other sentences.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

On def's failure to pay the fine, Court orders 60 days jail.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brad Joseph Fowler in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recalls @ 3:10 pm.  Payment to defer until jail completed. Def. will be in jail until 13 months.  Def. explains source of income. Court will defer until def. get's out of jail & payment to commence 60 days after get's out of jail.

Defendant Brad Joseph Fowler in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 2:44 pm.  Plea advisement filed.  State moves to vacate Habitual offender, & gives plea agreement, Poss of THC, 2nd offense, 6 months jail, consecutive to all sentences, 3 days credit, costs. Atty Nocco agrees, Def. agrees to plea agreement. Court will delete repeater in ct 1.    Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Examination  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause.  Information Filed. Atty Nocco has copy of information & waives reading. Def. admits prior conviction. Ct 1 Poss of THC, 2nd offense, no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Atty Nocco finds factual basis & is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Poss of THC 2nd offense.  Def. makes statement. Court accepts plea agreement & orders 6 months jail, consecutive to all other sentences, 3 days credit, time served,  huber privileges, c. no later than 12-15-14 @ 6 pm. & costs & $250 DNA surcharge. Bond to be returned to poster & given p.p. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Brad Joseph Fowler in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:13 p.m. Statement by District Attorney.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brad Joseph Fowler in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
